wexpman.presentationlayer.utils

Class FacesUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • wexpman.presentationlayer.utils.FacesUtils

  • public final class FacesUtils
extends Object
    Common methods used with Java Server Faces and Portlets. Several versions are available on the Internet, such as: http://blogs.steeplesoft.com/facesutil-a-missing-yet-important-piece/ http://kickjava.com/src/org/apache/cocoon/faces/FacesUtils.java.htm http://www .koders.com/java/fidC332399BC9E171ABD0AC09CB20CE2D4D6BA36E8A.aspx?s= facesutils.java#L4 http://www.koders.com/java/fid96ECFFF671B16CF2F9858E71A6A8294B2392E55E.aspx http://www.krugle.org/examples/p-O4vlis8Bagstb5dN/FacesUtils.java http://www.koders.com/java/fid5D222C34B7B07CCA1DB44CD83AA44CD6168A3B82.aspx

    • Method Detail

      • carryRequestParameterOntoRenderPhase

        public static void carryRequestParameterOntoRenderPhase(String parameterName)
        Gets the request parameter identified by the given name and sets it as a render parameter, effectively taking it from the action phase to the render phase This is very much related to the problem described at http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MYFACES-788 In brief, JSF knows about a single request that comprises both request portlets know about (action and render). Because of this, parameters included in the pages (e.g. the jsps) or otherwise in action methods, and which are intended to survive until the render phase do not make it This method should only be invoked during the process action phase
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the String name of the request parameter to carry onto the render phase
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the method is invoked during a phase other than the action phase
        IllegalArgumentException - if no value for the specified parameter is found among the request parameters

      • findComponentByType

        public static javax.faces.component.UIComponent findComponentByType(javax.faces.component.UIComponent startingComponent,
                                                    Class type)
        Finds the first component in the component tree which starts with the given component, which is of the given class
        Parameters:
        startingComponent - the component that is the root to start searching, can be UIViewRoot as obtained by FacesContext.getViewRoot() because it extends UIComponent
        type - the Class of the component being sought
        Returns:
        the first component of the given Class that is found in the tree, null if no component of the given class is found

      • getPortletPreference

        public static String getPortletPreference(String preferenceName)
        Gets the portlet preference associated with the given key (preference name) Assumes there is only one value for the preference, if there are multiple values it will return the first one
        Parameters:
        preferenceName - the name of the requested preference, as a String
        Returns:
        the value of the portlet preference requested, as a String
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is no value for a preference by the given name

      • getPortalUserName

        public static String getPortalUserName()
        Get the user name of the user who is currently logged in.
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the user, or null if it could not be determined
